result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelo A McCaleb

records.addlTxt: Defendant Angelo A McCaleb in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Parties requests more time for review. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Attorney Robert E Webb in court, defendant Angelo A McCaleb not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense still needs discovery. Case is adjourned in Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Angelo A McCaleb in court, appear by video with attorney Robert E Webb, appear in person.  Defendant Angelo A McCaleb in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective S. Schmitz.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed. Defendant's motion to Modify Bond

Court ordered no contact with Rashuan S.; Shamika S.; and/or Leah W.  Court also ordered defendant kept separate from co-def while in custody.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring;  24 hour curfew.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $20,000.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Angelo A McCaleb in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Defendant Angelo A McCaleb in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Angelo A McCaleb appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense request to be heard on bail at preliminary hearing.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 055598,
Payable Number: 1013246,
Receipt Number: 22RP024019,
Amount: $20.00
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
